newsitem.title: ITALY: ISCO sees Italy 1997 GDP at 1.1 pct,CPI at 2.1 pct.
newsitem.headline: ISCO sees Italy 1997 GDP at 1.1 pct,CPI at 2.1 pct.

text.p: Italy's research institute for economic conditions (ISCO) said on Thursday it forecast Italy's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) rising 1.1 percent in 1997, while annual Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation would average 2.1 percent.
ISCO made these foreasts for 1997 GDP and CPI in its monthly report.

ISCO said if all the government's corrective supplementary budget measures are fully effective and yields of government bonds fall by 0.5 percentage points by the end of the year, then the budget deficit will fall to three percent of GDP in 1997.
For 1998, ISCO sees a rise of 2.1 percent in GDP and an average CPI inflation rate of two percent.
ISCO says the 1.1 percent rise in GDP forecast for this year was only very modest with a rise forecast in the second half of the year after a level close to zero in the first quarter.
On inflation, ISCO sees a small rise in the rate in the second half of the year, with a dip below the two percent level around the middle of the year.

In the Italian Treasury's latest official quarterly accounts published in March, it forecast GDP growth of 1.2 percent this year and 2.2 percent in 1998, and on CPI inflation forecast an average rate of 2.5 percent in 1997 and 2.0 percent in 1998.
